resources.string: The Housing Hackathon is a multi-round competition where teams will participate to develop innovative solutions for modern housing challenges.
Creating tools and strategies to reduce housing costs and improve affordability.
Developing eco-friendly and energy-efficient housing solutions.
Designing solutions that cater to students, such as affordable, flexible, and community-oriented housing options.
Enhancing housing accessibility for individuals with disabilities or special needs and improving access for low-income households.

- Teams of 3-5 participants will present their idea along with a basic UI/UX prototype.\n- Judges will evaluate the ideas based on creativity, feasibility, and impact.\n- Top 20 teams will advance to the next round.

- The top 20 qualifying teams will design and develop the code for their project.\n- Teams will have 48 hours to submit a working prototype addressing their proposed solution.\n- Only teams that submit a fully functioning project will progress to the final round.

- Teams that successfully submit a running project in Round 2 will advance to the final round.\n- Finalists will present their complete project in front of sponsors and industry experts in-person.\n- Presentations will include a live demo and a pitch on the solutionâ€™s potential housing impact.

Top 3 teams will secure internship positions at leading Canadian companies, including:
- RBC (Royal Bank of Canada)
- Shopify
- Scotiabank
- Telus
- CIBC (Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce)
Teams will have access to mentors from the tech and housing industries for guidance.
Solutions will be judged on innovation, technical execution, impact potential, and user experience.
Thank You For Submitting the Feedback!
